Description: Pottery Tell El-Yahudiyeh ware juglet; wheel-made; concave neck with rolled rim; vertical handle from below rim to shoulder; piriform body; button base; decorated all over body with closely spaced, punctured vertical zig-zags; traces of highly lustrous burnishing; fabric dark grey with red core; surface near base poorly preserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (C101)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.6-7, Fig 8)
Kaplan 1980 / The Origin and Distribution of Tell el Yahudiyeh Ware. (P. 306, Fig. 98.a)
